正如预期的那样，最高法院将审理一个试图限制联邦官员与社交媒体公司之间接触的有争议的案件。此案可能会对社交媒体公司如何制定政策和内容审核决策产生广泛影响。

该案源于密苏里州和路易斯安那州总检察长提起的一项诉讼，指控拜登政府官员、疾病预防控制中心和联邦调查局在与 Meta、谷歌和 Twitter 的交易中过度干预，因为这些公司对流行病和选举相关的错误信息做出了反应。下级法院此前发布了一项禁令，严格限制政府官员与社交媒体公司沟通的能力，不过后来放宽了一些限制。

现在，随着最高法院同意听取政府对此案的上诉，整个下级法院的命令仍被搁置。正如《纽约时报》 指出的那样，三名法官塞缪尔·阿利托、克拉伦斯·托马斯和尼尔·戈萨奇表示反对，称允许下级法院命令继续暂停的决定“非常令人不安”。

这并不是最高法院本学期审理的唯一涉及言论自由和社交媒体的案件。法院还将审理两个具有里程碑意义的案件，这些案件可能会重塑社交媒体平台执行内容审核规则的方式。这些案件涉及德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州的两项州法律，这两项法律将阻止社交媒体公司删除某些类型的帖子。

(Photo by Mandel NGAN / AFP) (Photo by MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images)US-JUSTICE-COURT Twitch will allow simulcasting to competitor streaming platforms

Twitch 现在将允许其用户在其他直播视频网站上同时进行流媒体播放。这一消息是在拉斯维加斯TwitchCon 大会上发布的，同时还发布了新的联播指南。该公司强调，只要其他平台上的“Twitch 用户体验不受影响”，就允许同时直播。

早在 8 月份，Twitch 就放宽了跨流媒体规则，允许频道的直播内容出现在TikTok和 Instagram 等社交媒体应用上。至于现在哪些新的竞争对手服务是合乎规范的，Twitch 的措辞很宽泛——表示“任何服务”都可以考虑。唯一的例外似乎是与 Twitch 签署了独家合同的频道。

我们已经宣布您可以在任何直播流媒体服务上同时直播！
请在此处查看我们的新指南和常见问题解答： https://t.co/bTVF3hkpV9 #TwitchConVegas

- Twitch 支持 (@TwitchSupport) 2023 年 10 月 20 日

新的联播方式似乎会损害公司的利润。直播平台需要更多的艺人，那么为什么要允许用户将他们的内容带到其他地方呢？此举可能是对几位知名流媒体跳槽并与该领域的竞争对手（特别是 YouTube） 签署协议的回应。这纯粹是猜测，但也许为创作者提供不附加任何条件的额外收入来源可能足以让主要玩家留在船上，而中型流媒体则对他们的收入感到满意。

Twitch 一直在努力全面更新政策，以让用户和投资者都满意。该公司刚刚试图解决平台外人肉搜索问题，甚至还涉足了可以调节聊天的机器学习程序。它还引入了从其他社交媒体公司借用的新功能，例如故事和提要。

在周五的 TwitchCon 拉斯维加斯开幕式上， Twitch首席执行官丹·克兰西 (Dan Clancy) 就该平台的非服务行为政策发布了重要公告。从现在开始，Twitch 将对在其平台之外进行人肉搜索和殴打他人的用户采取行动。

人肉搜索（发布某人的全名和地址等个人信息）和打压（拨打恶作剧电话向某人家中派遣紧急服务）长期以来一直是直播社区中存在的问题。现在，如果 Twitch 发现主播或其他用户在其他平台上甚至离线时对某人进行人肉搜索或攻击，它可能会暂停或禁止他们的帐户。

Twitch 于 2021 年 4 月开始执行其非服务行为政策。当时，它表示将对“对 Twitch 社区构成重大安全风险”的严重事件做出反应，即使这些事件发生在自己的平台之外。在对平台外活动采取任何执法行动之前，Twitch 需要提供此类事件发生的证据。

该政策涵盖不当性行为、恐怖活动和招募、大规模暴力的明确或可信威胁以及成为已知仇恨团体的领导人或成员等问题。该平台还针对针对 Twitch 及其员工以及分享有害错误信息的人的威胁采取行动。鉴于此类行为的严重性，有时甚至是致命的性质，将人肉搜索和殴打添加到列表中是一个姗姗来迟的举措。

呼叫所有 Mod！

我们正在推出频道级聊天警告，这将允许您在需要时匿名向用户发送警告。 pic.twitter.com/l5mNK4QMej

- Twitch (@Twitch) 2023 年 10 月 20 日

Twitch 在 TwitchCon 上还发布了一些其他与安全相关的公告。主播和模组很快就能向越界的聊天者匿名发送警告。相关聊天者需要先确认警告，然后才能再次在聊天框中键入内容。 Twitch 指出，许多主播都有一个非正式的三击系统来确保社区安全，而频道级聊天警告功能也与此相一致。

今年早些时候，Twitch 开始测试名为“智能检测”的 AutoMod 功能。这会根据主播及其 mod 所做的审核操作来调整AutoMod （一种自动将不当内容排除在流聊天之外的工具）。智能检测现已在所有英语频道上线。 Twitch 计划在未来更广泛地推广它。

您不能相信维基百科页面上的所有内容，这就是为什么参考脚注中引用的原始来源很重要。但有时，即使是主要来源也可能会让您误入歧途。研究人员开发了一种人工智能，专注于通过训练算法来识别网站上有问题的引用，从而提高维基百科引用的可靠性。

这个名为 SIDE 的程序会做两件事：检查主要来源是否准确并建议新的来源。然而，人工智能的运行前提是维基百科的声明是真实的。这意味着，虽然它可以检查来源的有效性，但它实际上无法验证条目中的声明。

在一项研究中， 70% 的情况下，人们更喜欢人工智能建议的引文，而不是原始的引文。研究人员发现，在近 50% 的案例中，SIDE 提供的来源已被维基百科用作首要参考。在 21% 的情况下，当 SIDE 提出一项已被研究中的人类注释者认为合适的建议时，它就领先了一步。

虽然人工智能似乎证明它可以有效地帮助编辑验证维基百科的说法，但研究人员承认，替代程序在质量和速度上都可能优于他们当前的设计。 SIDE 的功能有限，即该程序仅考虑与网页相对应的引用。事实上，维基百科引用了除图像和视频等文本之外的其他媒体呈现的书籍、科学文章和信息。但超出其技术限制，维基百科的整个前提是任何地方的任何作者都可以指定对某个主题的引用。研究人员认为，维基百科本身的使用可能会限制这项研究。他们暗示，根据相关主题的性质，将引文插入网站的个人可能会渗透偏见。

同时，我们都知道，任何程序，尤其是依赖于训练的人工智能，都可能容易暴露其程序员的偏见。用于训练和评估 SIDE 模型的数据在这方面可能会受到限制。但尽管如此，使用人工智能简化事实核查或至少将其用作支持工具的好处可能会在其他地方产生反响。维基百科和社交媒体公司都需要应对不良行为者和机器人，这些行为者和机器人充斥着数字城镇广场的虚假信息。在围绕以色列-哈马斯战争和即将到来的美国总统选举传播错误信息之后，这一点现在比以往任何时候都更加真实和重要。人工智能工具（例如专门为此目的而设计的 SIDE）可以促进减少在线错误信息的需求。但在此之前还需要取得一些进展。

自从 Facebook 发布雷朋品牌的智能眼镜以来，两年来发生了很多变化。 Facebook 现在更名为 Meta。而它的智能眼镜也有了一个新名字：Ray-Ban Meta智能眼镜。两年前，我不确定自己对该产品的感受。雷朋 Stories 是我尝试过的最精致的智能眼镜，但由于相机质量平庸，它们感觉更像是一种新奇的东西，而不是大多数人可以使用的东西。

在佩戴该公司最新款售价 299 美元的太阳镜一周后，它们仍然感觉有点新奇。但 Meta 成功地改进了核心功能，同时通过直播和免提照片消息等新功能使它们变得更加有用。人工智能助手的加入带来了一些有趣的可能性。仍然存在隐私问题，但这些改进可能会让这种权衡变​​得更值得，特别是对于创作者和那些已经熟悉 Meta 平台的人来说。

发生了什么变化

就像它的前身一样，雷朋 Meta 智能眼镜的外观和感觉更像是一副雷朋眼镜，而不是一个小玩意，这仍然是一件好事。 Meta 缩小了框架和充电盒的尺寸，现在看起来就像经典的棕褐色皮革雷朋小包。这款眼镜仍然比一副典型的墨镜笨重一些，但即使长时间使用，它们也不会感觉很重。

今年的型号放弃了原来的电源开关，这很好。现在，当您将眼镜从眼镜盒中取出并戴上时，眼镜会自动打开（尽管有时您必须启动 Meta View 应用程序才能将它们连接到手机）。

现在，眼镜本身可以通过鼻托无线充电，而不是在铰链附近。据 Meta 称，该设备一次充电可使用约 4 小时，充电盒还可额外容纳 4 次电量。在一周的适度使用中，我不需要给充电盒充电，但我确实希望能比前面的灯更准确地指示其电池电量（Meta View 应用程序将显示电池的确切电量）你的眼镜，但情况并非如此。）

我的另一个小抱怨是，新的充电设置使得将眼镜从眼镜盒中取出变得更加困难。将镜架从磁性充电触点上拉下来需要一点力，而且外壳的垂直方向使得很容易抓住（和弄脏）镜片。

最新一代的智能眼镜既有标志性的 Wayfarer 风格（起价 299 美元），也有全新的圆形“Headliner”设计（售价 329 美元）。我选择了一双蓝色“闪亮牛仔裤”颜色的 Headliners，但也有棕褐色和黑色的款式。关于新颜色需要注意的一件事是，“闪亮牛仔裤”和“闪亮焦糖”选项都是稍微透明的，因此您可以看到框架中嵌入的一些电路和其他技术。

较浅的颜色还使每个镜头顶角的摄像头和 LED 指示灯比黑色镜头更加突出。 （Meta 还更新了其软件，以防止在 LED 被遮盖时使用摄像头。）这些都没有让我烦恼，但如果你想要更微妙的外观，黑框更能掩盖内部的技术。

新相机，更好的音频

不过，仔细观察透明框架，您可以看到许多升级的证据。现在每对嵌入了五个麦克风，每个臂上有两个，物镜转换器上有一个。额外的麦克风还为视频提供了一些新的“沉浸式”音频功能。如果您录制的剪辑包含多个来源的声音（例如某人在您前面说话，另一个人在您后面说话），那么当您通过帧回放视频时，您可以听到他们的声音来自不同的方向。这是一个巧妙的技巧，但感觉不是特别有用。

然而，定向音频是音质显着改善的标志。与上一代不同的是，开放式扬声器的声音提高了 50%，并且在较高音量时不会失真。 Meta 表示，新设计还减少了声音泄漏量，但我发现这实际上取决于您正在收听的音量以及周围的噪音条件。

当谈到开放式扬声器时，总会有一些质量权衡，但这仍然是我最喜欢的眼镜功能之一。与我使用耳塞或耳机体验过的任何“透明模式”相比，该设计使环境噪音水平更加平衡。当您想要保持对周围事物的了解时，它对于慢跑或徒步旅行等活动尤其有用。

相机质量是第一代 Ray-Ban Stories 中最令人失望的功能之一，因此我很高兴看到 Meta 和 Luxottica 放弃了动力不足的 5 兆像素相机，转而使用 12MP 超广角相机。

升级后的摄像头仍然不如大多数手机那么清晰，但对于社交媒体来说已经足够了。光天化日下拍摄的照片清晰，色彩比原版雷朋故事的照片更加平衡，后者往往看起来处理过度。令我惊讶的是，即使是我在室内或黄昏时拍摄的照片（大多数人不会戴墨镜的场合）看起来也很不错。不过，关于超广角镜头的一个注意事项是：如果您有长发或刘海，一不小心，一缕头发很容易落在画面边缘。

该相机还有一些自己的新技巧。除了 60 秒的视频外，您现在还可以直接从眼镜直播到您的 Instagram 或 Facebook 帐户。您甚至可以使用眼镜侧面的触摸控件来收听关注者的点赞和评论。作为本周之前曾在我的个人 Instagram 帐户上直播过一次的人，我无法想象自己会使用这一功能。

但尝试之后，发现比我想象的要酷很多。从眼镜上传输第一人称视图比拿起手机要容易得多，并且能够在第一人称视图和手机摄像头视图之间无缝切换，我认为这对创作者来说非常有用。我仍然看不到未来会有很多 IG Live，但智能眼镜可以为内容创作者带来一些真正有创意的用例。

我真正欣赏的另一个新相机功能是能够拍摄照片并仅使用语音命令通过 WhatsApp 或 Messenger（但不是 Instagram DM）直接与联系人分享。虽然这意味着您无法在发送照片之前查看照片，但这是一种在旅途中共享照片的更快、更方便的方式。

元人工智能

两年前，我真的不明白在 Ray-Ban Stories 上使用语音命令有什么意义。在公共场合说“嘿 Facebook”感觉太尴尬了，而且这个功能似乎没什么意义。然而，Meta 人工智能助手的加入使得语音交互成为一个关键功能，而不是事后才想到的。

Meta Ray-Ban 智能眼镜是首批内置 Meta 新型生成式人工智能助手的硬件产品之一。这意味着您可以与助手讨论一系列主题。查询的答案通过内部扬声器广播，您可以在 Meta View 应用程序中重新访问过去的问题和回复。

需要明确的是：我仍然觉得说“嘿 Meta”或“OK Meta”很奇怪，而且还没有在公开场合这样做过。但现在至少有一个你可能想要这样做的理由。目前，助手无法提供除当前时间或天气预报以外的“实时”信息。因此，它无法帮助解决一些实际问题，例如有关体育排名或交通状况的问题。助手的“知识截止点”是 2022 年 12 月，对于大多数与时事相关的问题，它会提醒您这一点。然而，我问了几个问题，它产生了幻觉，并给出了虚构的（但听起来很真实）答案。 Meta 表示，这种事情是大型语言模型开发中预期的一部分，但在使用 Meta AI 时要记住这一点很重要。

Meta 建议您应该更多地使用它来解决创意或一般兴趣问题，例如基本琐事或旅行想法。与其他生成式人工智能工具一样，我发现你的问题越有创意、越具体，答案就越好。例如，“嘿，Meta，关于金门大桥景观的 Instagram 标题有什么有趣的”，产生了一个非常通用的响应，听起来更像是广告。但“嘿，Meta，为金门大桥的照片写一个有趣的标题，我可以在我猫的 Instagram 帐户上分享”，效果稍好一些。

也就是说，我与 Meta AI 的互动基本上没有给我留下深刻的印象。尽管与该公司充满陈词滥调的名人聊天机器人相比，我很欣赏眼镜上 Meta AI 的中立个性，但该功能仍然感觉有些新奇。

尽管我对此持怀疑态度，但 Meta 给出了一些关于该技术未来可能性的暗示。在 Connect 的舞台上，该公司提供了即将推出的功能的预览，该功能将允许佩戴者根据他们通过眼镜看到的内容提出问题。例如，您可以查看一座纪念碑，并要求 Meta 识别您正在查看的内容。据该公司称，这种“多模式”搜索功能将于明年某个时候推出，我期待着更新推出后重新访问 Meta AI。

隐私

生成式人工智能的加入也引发了新的隐私问题。首先，即使您已经拥有 Facebook 或 Instagram 帐户，您也需要一个Meta 帐户才能使用眼镜。虽然这也意味着他们不要求您使用 Facebook 或 Instagram，但并不是每个人都会对创建另一个元链接帐户的想法感到兴奋。

Meta View 应用程序仍然没有广告，该公司表示不会将您的照片或视频内容用于广告。默认情况下，该应用程序将存储语音命令的转录本，但您可以选择从应用程序的设置中删除转录本和关联的录音。如果您允许该应用程序存储录音，这些录音可以向“经过培训的审阅者”展示，以“改进、排除故障并培训 Meta 的产品”。

我询问该公司是否计划使用 Meta AI 查询来为其广告提供信息，一位发言人表示，“目前我们不会使用为我们的对话式人工智能（包括智能眼镜上的人工智能）提供支持的生成式人工智能模型来个性化广告。”因此，您可以放心，您与 Meta AI 的交互不会被输入到 Meta 的广告定位机器中，至少目前是这样。但想象有一天这种情况会发生改变并不是没有道理的。 Meta 倾向于在新产品开始时保持无广告，并在新产品开始吸引大量用户时引入广告。 Snap等其他公司已经在使用生成式人工智能来推动其广告业务。

他们值得吗？

如果其中任何一个让您感到不舒服，或者您有兴趣在非 Meta 应用程序中使用墨镜，那么您可能需要避开 Ray-Ban Meta 智能眼镜。虽然您的照片和视频可以导出到任何应用程序，但大多数设备的关键功能在您在 Meta 生态系统中玩时才能发挥最佳效果。例如，您可以连接 WhatsApp 和 Messenger 帐户来发送免提照片或文本，但眼镜不支持其他第三方消息应用程序。 （Meta AI 会读出传入的文本，并可以通过手机的本机消息应用程序发送照片和文本）。同样，直播功能仅限于 Instagram 和 Facebook，不适用于其他平台。

不过，如果您是创作者或已经在 Meta 的应用程序中花费了大量时间，那么有很多理由值得您关注第二代色调。虽然两年前的 Ray-Ban Stories 是一款有趣但过于昂贵的新奇产品，但 299 美元的 Ray-Ban Meta 智能眼镜感觉更像是成品。改进的音频和照片质量更好地证明了价格的合理性，而人工智能的加入让它们感觉像是一个可能会改进的产品，而不是一个一旦你购买就会开始过时的小工具。

我们正处于亚马逊10 月 Prime Day促销和黑色星期五之间的尴尬时期，但如果您等不及再等几周才能开始假日购物，那么今天您可以利用一些著名的科技优惠。例如， 三星 S90C和TCL QM8等高端电视的价格均跌至历史新低，预算级海信 U6K也是如此。如果你想要一套新的无线耳机，Lightning 版本的AirPods Pro比苹果标价低 60 美元，而钱包友好的Jabra Elite 3则低至 40 美元。我们还看到Anker 壁式充电器、推荐游戏笔记本电脑等的折扣。以下是本周您今天仍然可以获得的最佳科技优惠。

三星S90C

55 英寸三星 S90C已降至 1,298 美元，创下新低，比我们本月初看到的售价低约 150 美元。这款 OLED 电视获得了几乎一致的好评，因为它提供了优质 OLED 电视所应有的高对比度、流畅的运动和宽视角，同时又不牺牲峰值亮度和色彩饱和度。这是因为它使用 QD-OLED 面板，将 OLED 技术与量子点层混合在一起。最大的好处是，与标准 OLED 电视相比，它在明亮的房间里的显示效果更好（尽管它的亮度不如最好的 LCD 电视）。 S90C 还为游戏做好了准备，因为它具有四个 HDMI 2.1 端口，可支持高达 144Hz 的 4K 刷新率。主要缺点是它不支持杜比视界 HDR（与所有三星电视一样），并且其默认的 Tizen 软件可能有点笨拙。

TCL QM8

如果您的客厅特别容易受到眩光的影响， TCL QM8是一款备受好评的液晶电视，它具有更高的峰值亮度以及量子点和类似的游戏功能。它还使用迷你 LED 背光来帮助提高对比度，但它看起来不像优质 OLED 电视那样色彩丰富，而且视角也更窄。目前，65 英寸型号的售价已降至 901 美元，创下新低，比平时的市场价格低约 200 美元。 海信 U8K是另一款获得同样高分的液晶电视，也值得注意，尽管该电视的 65 英寸版本目前售价为 1,098 美元。

海信U6K

更接近预算市场，75 英寸海信 U6K 的售价为 698 美元，这又是历史最低价，比近几个月的正常市场价格低了 100 美元。与 QM8 相比，这是一款更为基本的液晶电视，因此它看起来不会那么充满活力，刷新率仅限于 60Hz，并且完全缺少 HDMI 2.1 端口。也就是说，它的价格要便宜得多，而且是少数支持 mini-LED 背光、全阵列局部调光和量子点色彩的入门级电视之一。 其他地方的评论表明，这些功能有助于它提供比同价位大多数电视更好的对比度和色彩。它还使用 Google TV 平台， 我们发现该平台易于使用。不过，与大多数廉价电视一样，从某个角度观看时，它会显得褪色。如果 75 英寸的套装太大， 55 英寸和65 英寸的型号仍然可以以我们本月早些时候看到的最低价格购买。

Anker 壁式充电器促销

Anker 的一些优质壁式充电器本周开始销售。 Anker 736 充电器就是其中之一，价格从平时的 60 美元降至 43 美元。这是一个较大的型号，适用于笔记本电脑或多设备充电，因为它有两个 USB-C 端口，可以与 USB-A 端口一起单独输出高达 100W 的功率。与此同时， Anker 735 充电器也有类似的端口选择，最高功率为 65W，但整体封装较小；降价至 40 美元，折扣 20 美元。对于不太费力的需求， Anker 511 充电器的尺寸更接近旧款 iPhone 充电器，并配备一个 30W USB-C 端口。该产品售价 17 美元，比平常便宜约 3 美元。最后，您可以以 14 美元的价格购买两件装的Anker PowerPort III 20W Cube ，大约有 4 美元的折扣。它的外形与 511 类似，但最高功率为 20W，如果您只需要非 Pro iPhone，这可能就足够了。

苹果AirPods Pro

Apple 第二代 AirPods Pro的 Lightning 版本重新发售，售价 189 美元。这与我们在本月早些时候亚马逊 Prime Big Deal Days 促销期间看到的历史最低价相符，并且比近几个月耳机的典型市场价格低了 10 美元。 AirPods Pro 是我们的 无线耳机购买指南中“最适合 iOS 的选择”，并在去年年底获得了 Engadget 的 88 分评价。它们继续提供令人愉悦的温暖声音、有效的噪音消除、出色的透明模式以及与其他 Apple 设备的一系列有用的集成。最近的更新还添加了有用的“自适应音频”模式。但请注意， 苹果上个月发布了一款配备USB-C 充电盒（以及改进的防尘性能）的更新型号。截至撰写本文时，该产品尚未打折，但随着黑色星期五的临近，我们可能会看到折扣。

Govee M1 LED 灯条

Govee 的 M1 LED 灯带在亚马逊上售价 70 美元，附赠 30 美元优惠券，与我们见过的最低价格相当。这是一条 16.4 英尺长的条带，您可以将其剪下来并粘贴在您的房子周围，以获得色彩缤纷的环境照明。它的颜色明亮且饱和，通过 Govee 的应用程序，您可以将几种不同的效果应用到一条条带的不同部分。如果您想让房间更具俱乐部氛围，它也可以与音乐同步。 Alexa、Google Assistant 和新的Matter智能家居标准均受支持。请注意，当它不活跃时，它可能会有点碍眼，因此您可能不想将其直接暴露在外。目前，我们在最佳智能灯泡指南中推荐 M1。

捷波朗精英 3

Jabra 的 Elite 3耳机在百思买 (Best Buy) 的售价降至 40 美元，与历史最低价持平，比平均市场价格低约 25 美元。早在 2021 年，我们就给这款无线耳机评分为 88 分，目前我们在最佳预算无线耳机指南中推荐它。价格不到 50 美元，其适度的低音增强声音仍然令人印象深刻，而其紧凑的设计、紧密贴合和 IP55 级防水使其成为锻炼的绝佳选择。电池续航时间也不错，每次充电大约七小时左右。不过，它的功能有点不足，因为没有无线充电、磨损检测、多设备配对或主动降噪功能。

Keychron V3

无键Keychron V3机械键盘售价降至 69 美元，比其典型价格低约 15 美元。亚马逊也以5 美元以上的价格出售。这是我们最佳游戏键盘指南的推荐，因为我们认为对于那些希望将机械键盘作为一种爱好的人来说，这是一个很好的切入点。它结构坚固，与所有主要操作系统兼容，并可通过一些舒适的开关进行配置。 （从广义上讲，触觉 K Pro Brown 最适合打字，而线性 K Pro Red 则玩游戏速度更快。）这些开关经过预先润滑，因此开箱即用，按下时感觉顺畅而饱满，而 PBT-涂层键帽手感清脆稳定。并不是非常安静，但也不是非常吵闹。它还支持热插拔，因此自定义按键和开关相当简单。

三星 Evo 选择

三星 Evo Select microSD 卡的 512GB 版本重新以 30 美元的价格出售，比我们在亚马逊 Prime Big Deal Days 促销期间看到的价格高出 2 美元，但仍比通常的市场价格低 5 美元。 Evo Select 是我们的microSD 卡购买指南中的“最佳价值”选择：它不是我们测试过的最快的卡，但对于那些希望以低成本增加 Nintendo Switch、Steam Deck 或 Raspberry Pi 存储空间的人来说，它完全足够了。如果你能再多付 5 美元， 三星 Pro Plus从技术上来说性能会更好，但该卡的价格并不比平常便宜。

微星 Stealth 14 Studio

配备 Intel Core i7-13620H 处理器、Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060 GPU、16GB RAM 和 1TB SSD 的MSI Stealth 14 Studio笔记本电脑在百思买的配置已降至 1,200 美元。这是我们见过的该型号的最低价格，比建议零售价低 300 美元。早在 6 月份，我们就给 Stealth 14 Studio 的评分为 87 分，称赞其引人注目且相对较轻（3.75 磅）的设计、坚固的扬声器以及适合日常游戏的强大性能。这是比我们评测的配置低端的配置——CPU 稍慢，而 14 英寸显示屏的 1,920 x 1,200 分辨率和 165Hz 刷新率较低——但总体情绪相同。主要缺点是它的 720p 网络摄像头中等，并且在胁迫下可能会发热。您仍然无法从像这样的游戏笔记本电脑中获得大量的电池寿命。 But if you want a more portable machine for gaming and media editing, there's good value here. We currently recommend the Stealth 14 Studio in our guide to the best Windows laptops .

ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14

The ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 is the top overall gaming pick in that guide, and it's now on sale for the same price at Best Buy. The model discounted here includes an AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS chip, a GeForce RTX 4060 GPU, 16GB of RAM, a 512GB SSD and a 14-inch, 1440p, 165Hz display. At $400 off ASUS' list price, this deal marks an all-time low. The G14's pitch is similar to the Stealth 14 Studio: It's a compact gaming laptop that doesn't totally sacrifice the "laptop" part. It's powerful enough to run modern games, but it's not an anchor at 3.64 pounds, and its keyboard and trackpad are comfortable. Whether you should get it over the MSI config above likely comes down to your willingness to trade storage space for a higher-res display. The G14 also has more ports, including two for USB-C and two for USB-A, though the Stealth 14 Studio includes a Thunderbolt 4 connector, which may be important if you ever want to use an external GPU.

Sonos Move

Sonos has its first-gen Move speaker down to $299, which is a $100 discount and matches an all-time low. This deal comes with a major caveat, as Sonos replaced the Move with the upgraded Move 2 earlier this year. We found the new model to deliver improved sound quality and far superior battery life in our review ; other upgrades include a redesigned set of touch controls and line-in support (with an optional adapter ). If you can spend another $150 — or wait for a potential sale — you should get that device instead. If you can't, though, the broad strokes of the original Move are similar: It's still a hefty yet portable speaker with balanced sound, a weather-resistant design and all the usual Sonos perks. It still pairs easily with other Sonos speakers and can connect to a range of streaming services, plus it supports AirPlay 2, Alexa and the Google Assistant. Its battery just lasts closer to 10 hours instead of 20 like the Move 2.

Mic modeling has come a long way in just a few years, and modern software plugins, to these ears, get quite close to the real deal. Universal Audio has been at the forefront of this technology for a while and now the company's released a new condenser microphone that integrates with its equally new Hemisphere mic modeling plugin.

The SC-1 is a large diaphragm condenser microphone, operating as part of the company's Standard Series that also includes the pre-existing SD-1 and SP-1. The SC-1 launches alongside the Hemisphere plugin that gives users digital access to a full range of classic mics from big-time companies like Neumann, Telefunken, AKG, Sony and others. The plugin uses a similar technology to the company's Sphere line of modeling microphones, but with a drastic reduction in cost, as the SC-1 costs $500 and Sphere microphones range from $800 to $1,400.

The Hemisphere plugin lets you instantly audition different microphones to suit the take, tweak proximity, adjust filters and more. All of these adjustments can be done before recording or afterward, just like with the Sphere line. One benefit the SC-1 boasts over the Sphere line is that it requires just a single XLR input, while Sphere microphones require two to properly capture that stereo field.

The Hemisphere modeling plugin also extends to those other Standard Series mics, like the SP-1 pencil microphone and the SD-1 dynamic microphone. As for the SC-1 itself, it's a standard no-frills large-diaphragm condenser with an extended dynamic range and a frequency response from 20 Hz to 20 kHz. There's also an emphasis on low self-noise output, which makes it easier to transform via the numerous modeling options.

Universal Audio's SC-1 is available for preorder right now and ships later in the fall. The microphone includes the Hemisphere modeling plugin, so your wallet won't have to double dip. Additionally, the plugin is a free upgrade for existing SD-1 and SP-1 owners.

Discord is introducing new safeguards to protect young users. On Thursday, the company announced Teen Safety Assist . The rollout will happen in the coming weeks and consists of two features: Automated alerts and content filters.

Moving forward, when a user a teen hasn't chatted with before sends a direct message, Discord will display a safety alert if the platform's automated systems suspect the teen's safety could be at risk. The prompt will nudge the young person to reconsider if they want to respond to the message, and point them to the app's block feature and related safety tips.

By default, Discord will now also automatically blur potentially sensitive images from a teen's friends. Young people can disable the feature through an option in Discord's settings menu. Adults, meanwhile, can enable the filters for themselves, if they want the additional protections.

The introduction of Teen Safety Assist comes amid increased scrutiny of Discord's efforts to limit the spread of child sexual abuse material (CSAM) and protect young users from predatory adults. In June, NBC News identified 35 cases over a period of six years where adults had allegedly used the platform to kidnap, groom or sexually assault minors. The outlet also found 165 cases where authorities were prosecuting adults for sharing CSAM over Discord or allegedly using the platform to extort young users into sending sexual images of themselves.

In the aftermath of the report, Discord banned teen dating servers and changed its safety policies to ban the sharing of AI-generated CSAM. It also announced new rules explicitly prohibiting any other kind of text or media content that sexualizes children. At the same time, the company introduced Family Center , a dashboard for parents and guardians to keep track of what their teens are doing on Discord.

“Teens are still in the process of learning about themselves and what it means to be online, and our new safety features are rooted in providing them with agency on the platform, to give them ways to learn and grow in safe and age-appropriate online spaces,” said Savannah Badalich, senior director of policy at Discord. “These newest features are part of an ongoing, multi-year effort to continually evolve and advance safety on Discord.”

At the same time, Discord is introducing a new warning system for people who violate its policies. Outside of incidents involving the most “extreme” violations, the company is moving away from permanent bans. It's doing so under the belief that most users will choose to be better online citizens given the chance and proper guidance.

In practice, the system will notify a person when they've violated one or more of Discord's policies and detail the restrictions on their account. It will also link out to the company's Terms of Service , Community Guidelines and appeal mechanism. A new “Account Standing” tab within the settings menu will allow users to see all their current and past policy violations.

“We think we've built the most nuanced and proportionate reporting system,” Badalich told Engadget, adding the company hopes other platforms will look to what Discord has created for inspiration related to their own enforcement efforts. “We believe people, especially teens, have the capacity to grow.”

Separately, Discord announced a slew of new features and enhancements slated to arrive either in the near future or down the line. To start, the platform's in-app shop, which Discord began testing last month with Nitro subscribers , will soon be available to all users. The marketplace features digital items people can use to decorate their avatars and profiles. Discord will offer store discounts to Nitro members, as part of a new perk for signing up.

This week, the company will also start a broad roll-out of a feature called Remix . It allows users to edit an image directly within Discord's mobile app and share it with their friends and servers. The company spent much of the last year improving its Android and iOS clients. One recent update saw it improve app launch times on both platforms. In the near future, Discord says people can expect a new “Midnight” dark mode the company claims reduces battery consumption on devices with OLED screens, more functional notification tabs and a new search feature for the settings menu to make it easier to find the exact option you're looking to tweak.

Last but not least, the company says it will begin rolling out Premium App Subscriptions to eligible developers in the UK and Europe, following a launch that began in the US a few weeks ago. On the subject of third-party apps, bots and plugins, the company said it's in the process of exploring how to make those accessible across nearly every part of Discord. It provided few details on the effort, but said the goal is to allow people to access their favorite apps and bots without those experiences being restricted to select servers.

“We're experimenting with a few different things, but the goal is for developers to reach more people with the awesome experience they're building. For users, we don't want them to be gated from having these custom experiences at their fingertips,” Cherry Park, director of product marketing at Discord, told Engadget. “In terms of the way we architecture and build it, there are a couple of solutions. Some are easier, some are more difficult, and you're going to see us experiment with a few of them over the next few quarters.”

Discord promised to share more about its efforts around app portability in the near future. In the meantime, Nitro subscribers will get a chance to test new features before they become available to the public.

Wonder review: The joy of pure imagination

Mario has been stomping Goombas, smashing blocks and running from left to right for damn near 40 years. How is Nintendo supposed to keep its classic side scroller feeling fresh after all this time? First, you shift the location to a brand new kingdom. Next, you introduce a bunch of new enemies and power-ups. But what really pushes things over the top is the introduction of a new mechanic that turns everything you think you know about Mario games on its head . What you get is Super Mario Bros. Wonder , a game that dazzles and delights while living up to its name in a variety of ways.

Warning: This review includes some light spoilers, including the number of worlds and descriptions of some hidden levels.

The game starts simply enough with Mario and crew (Luigi, Peach, Toad, Yoshi, Nabbit and, for the first time, Daisy) visiting Prince Florian of the Flower Kingdom. But then Bowser barges in and steals a Wonder Flower, which somehow allows him to merge with Prince Florian's castle to create a floating mecha fortress of doom. From there, your job is to collect Wonder Seeds (this game's version of stars and shines) as you help the Florians restore order to their troubled land.

Right away, this has some subtle but important implications for the rest of the game. The first is that you immediately Wonder Flowers have wild and unpredictable effects. The second is that, because you're not simply recusing a princess trapped in a castle, the whole Flower Kingdom is working with you to take down Bowser. Sometimes that means you might be rescuing some trapped miners. But other times the Florians are the ones helping Mario (who also has a new voice actor for the first time) by rebuilding a bridge or donating a Wonder Seed at the beginning of a new world. The friendly little flowers scattered across each level will even shout words of encouragement or funny quips as you run by. But the impressive part is that, even in a relatively straightforward platformer like this, there's a sense of community that makes this world feel more lived in than a lot of epic RPGs.

You'll find a number of familiar baddies along with some new foes across an incredible range of environments and levels. Wonder features six main worlds each with a distinctive theme. But within those, you'll still run into reimagined haunted houses, pirate ships, underwater stages and more. One twist for this game is the addition of badges, which are earned by completing specific levels and some may even be required to find secrets or reveal alternate exits. Some allow you to jump farther or float, while others make extra coins appear. There are even protective badges, like the one that automatically saves you if you fall into lava or poison. It's a mechanic that feels inspired by recent roguelikes, such as Hades , and it does a great job of adding customizability and replayability.

However, the biggest twist in the game is the Wonder Flowers themselves. In addition to the one Bowser stole, there's also one hidden in almost every stage. And if you find it, you better be prepared for the unexpected. Touching them transports you to an alternate dimension where the rules of the Marioverse have been completely rewritten. In one level Super Stars rain down from the sky, while in another you might be transformed into a giant slime. You may also run into Wonder Flowers which converts the game from a side scroller into a top-down 2D maze or suddenly find yourself the target in a shooting gallery.

Almost every flower is different and the possibilities are seemingly endless. In a recent volume of Nintendo's Ask the Developer , I learned that the team had a wall of sticky notes with over 2,000 ideas, and after playing Wonder , I believe it. Wonder Flowers feel like they add an extra half a level to every stage; they're a delicious dessert on top of an already bountiful meal.

Even without the aid of a Wonder Flower, the sheer variety of level types is impressive. Alongside classic stages that are capped off by grabbing a flag, there are also races, badge challenges, puzzle levels and more. There are KO Arenas that let you pick your power-up of choice (Fire Flower, Elephant Suit, Bubble Mushroom or the Drill Hat) before taking down waves of enemies, while Break Time levels provide quick 30-second bursts of excitement. You'll never be bored, even if you want a change from standard platform jumping.

I also have to say that this might be the best Mario and friends have ever looked, and that includes recent 3D titles like Odyssey. There is just so much detail packed into every level and character. From the determined face Mario makes when he runs around, to the little flames that sprout from your feet every time you jump.

Wonder's map is also surprisingly engaging. In the beginning, I wasn't sure if the ability to freely roam around added all that much. But as I progressed, I found a number of secret nooks and crannies that wouldn't have fit if the game was locked to a handful of paths. And with Wonder Flowers giving Nintendo the freedom to mix and match mechanics and enemies, there's just so much to see.

Nintendo even managed to address a gripe I had about the pacing of previous 2D Marios. Since they're meant for both experienced gamers and children who might be new to the franchise, they often locked more challenging levels behind the story's completion. This meant the beginning of the game could be a slog as you rushed through easier levels to get to the more challenging bits. But with the addition of difficulty ratings and hidden paths that lead to 5-star levels long before you finish the game, there isn't the same rush to get to the “good stuff.” And I should say that 4- and particularly 5-star levels are balanced just right. Completing one feels like a rewarding challenge, without crossing over into punishing.

I do have some very minor complaints about things like mummy enemies (pulling their wraps feels a bit tedious) and I fear the Elephant Suit might be a bit overpowered in comparison to the Drill Hat. The 5-star levels and rhythm stages are also so good I wish there were more of them, I just can't get enough. And I'm slightly disappointed the adorable penguins from the movie didn't make an appearance somewhere in Wonder’s ice levels.

But on the whole, Super Mario Bros. Wonder is a marvelous game. Its art and animations have a level of polish that's practically unmatched by rival titles, and the addition of Wonder Seeds subverts your expectations and keeps this 40-year franchise feeling new and innovative. In a lot of ways, Wonder reminds me of my favorite 2D Mario game: Super Mario World . While I wish it didn't take more than 10 years for Nintendo to create a proper sequel to its last mainline platformer , if that's what it takes to get a game like this, I'm happy to sit and wonder what's next for Mario.

Wonder review NVIDIA's latest AI model helps robots perform pen spinning tricks as well as humans

The use for humans in the world of robotics, even as teachers, is shrinking thanks to AI. NVIDIA Research has announced the creation of Eureka , an AI agent powered by GPT-4 that has trained robots to perform tasks using reward algorithms. Notably, Eureka taught a robotic hand to do pen spinning tricks as well as a human can (honestly, as you can see in the YouTube video below , better than many of us).

Eureka has also taught quadruped, dexterous hands, cobot arms and other robots to open drawers, use scissors, catch balls and nearly 30 different tasks. According to NVIDIA Research, the AI agent's trial and error-based reward programs are 80 percent more effective than those written by human experts. This shift meant the robots' performance also improved by over 50 percent. Eureka also self-evaluates based on training results, instructing changes in reward functions as it sees fit.

NVIDIA Research has published a library of its Eureka algorithms, encouraging others to try them out on NVIDIA Isaac Gym , the organization's "physics simulation reference application for reinforcement learning research."

The idea of robots teaching robots is seeing increased interest and success. A May 2023 paper published in the Transactions on Machine Learning Research journal presented a new system called SKILL (Shared Knowledge Lifelong Learning), which allowed AI systems to learn 102 different skills, including diagnosing diseases from chest X-rays and identifying species of flowers. The AIs shared their knowledge — acting as teachers in a way — with each other over a communication network and were able to master each of the 102 skills. Researchers at schools like MIT and the University of Bristol have also had success, specifically in using AI to teach robots how to manipulate objects.
